text: We confirmed the dependence of PAO1 - induced <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-8 production on NF-kappaB activation using THP-1 cells expressing a reporter driven by NF-kappaB and AP-1 response elements .

text: We found that stimulation of primed THP-1 reporter cells with heat-killed PAO1 produced the highest levels of NF-kappaB / AP-1 activation ( Fig . 6a ) and this correlated with IL-8 secretion ( Fig . 6b ) but negligible amounts of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were secreted ( Fig . 6c ) .
Stimulation of primed THP-1 reporter cells with live PAO1 did not significantly increase NF-kappaB / AP-1 activity ( Fig . 6a ) or IL-8 secretion ( Fig . 6b ) over priming alone .

However , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was greatly augmented over primed cells stimulated with heat-killed PAO1 or unprimed cells stimulated with live PAO1 ( Fig . 6c ) .

text: This confirmed that NF-kappaB activation alone is not sufficient for maximal <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion , but increased priming of NF-kappaB is capable of augmenting <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production and secretion upon inflammasome stimulation .

text: Dependency of these responses on NF-kappaB was confirmed by pharmacologic inhibition of NF-kappaB using the Bay11-7082 inhibitor of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation , which significantly reduced NF-kappaB / AP-1 activation ( P < 0.001 ) ( Fig . 6d ) and the subsequent production of IL-8 ( P < 0.01 ) ( Fig . 6e ) and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( P < 0.001 ) ( Fig . 6f ) in response to both heat-killed and live PAO1 .

text: These results were also verified in CF and control PBMCs for each inflammasome examined ( P < 0.001 ) ( Fig . 6g-h ) .

Overall these results confirm that NF-kappaB is an important modulator of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production and that increased activation of NF-kappaB augments inflammasome - mediated production of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
